title: CORD SYSTEM
introduction: As in all martial arts, capoeira has its own graduation system. The level reached by the students is indicated by the color of their belt ("corda"), which for our group is summarized here:

cords.name: Corda Amarelo
cords.meaning: Gold signifies the value of apprenticeship

cords.name: Corda Laranja
cords.meaning: Sun reflects the awakening of the apprentice's consciousness

cords.name: Corda Azul
cords.meaning: Sea indicates the apprentice's awareness of the immense path ahead

cords.name: Corda Verde
cords.meaning: Forest signifies the consolidation of apprenticeship. This cord provides the base on which ABADÁ-Capoeira is built

cords.name: Corda Roxa
cords.meaning: The capoeirista begins to overcome the physical, psychological and spiritual pain of learning Capoeira and defending its ideals

cords.name: Corda Marron
cords.meaning: Chameleon represents the constant transformation that characterizes the ABADÁ style

cords.name: Corda Vermelha
cords.meaning: Ruby symbolizes justice. At this level, the capoeirista acquires an understanding of responsibility; he or she is expected to strive for justice in conducting his work and making her decisions

cords.name: Corda Vermelha-Branca
cords.meaning: Transformation. This phase sees the development of a capoeirista's full potential to maintain the ideals of ABADÁ. A Mestre begins preparing him/herself for the maximum grade by being honest, reliable, loyal and, above all, wise and impartial

cords.name: Corda Branca
cords.meaning: Diamond reflects all colors and is the hardest gem stone. The Grão Mestre sustains ABADÁ's system and preserves its ideals. All attributes of this grade are concentrated in one person who has the important responsibility of guiding the destiny of ABADÁ
